name: Elixir SMaSH
description: Single malt and single hop (SMaSH) double IPA. Elixir hops are French hops known for elements of wood, citurs, and floral, the perfect combo for an IPA.

malts: 18 lbs Great Western Pale High Color Malt
yeast: 1 package White Labs California Ale Yeast (WLP001)

brewing_instructions: Add 6 gallons of water to the kettle and add brewing salts (Campden Tablet, Epsom Salt, Calcium Chloride and Gypsum)
Heat 6 gallons of strike water to 162°F
Add 6 gallons of water to the mash tun
Add all grains to the mash tun and confirm mash temperature of 151°F
Steep grains for 60 minutes
While steeping grains, heat 4 gallons of water for lautering to 170 °F
Fly spage until wort volume of 7.3 gallons is reached
Begin boil and wait for hot break
Add 7 drops of FermCap to reduce foaming
At 0 minutes, add 2.0 oz Elixir hops
At 30 minutes, add 2.0 oz Elixir hops
At 50 minutes, add 1.0 oz Elixir hops
At 50 minutes, add 1 tablet Whirlfloc
At 50 minutes, add 0.5 tsp of yeast nutrient
At 60 minutes, chil the wort to 68°F
Shake fermenter to aerate wort
Move wort to primary fermenter
Pitch yeast
Ferment at 67°F for 5 days
Ferment at 72°F for 2 days
Ferment at 65°F for 7 days
Cold crash to 36°F for 7 days
Move to keg and carbonate
starter_brewing_instructions: Add 3L of water to Ehrlenmeyer Flask
Add 6 oz Extra Light Dry Malt Extract
Add 2 drops FermCap to reduce foaming as needed
Allow yeast to multiply for 24 hours
